content: aberdeen hat & scarf by felecia o connell finished measurements hat us 10 6mm 16 circular needles hat 16 20 5 22 5 circumference x 10 5 plus dpn s or size to obtain gauge 11 11 5 high to fit head circumference scarf us 10 6mm straight or short of 18 22 24 circular needles or size to obtain gauge scarf 10 25 x 60 notions yarn stitch marker hat only knit picks wool of the andes superwash yarn needle bulky 100% superwash wool 137 gauge yards/100g mineral heather 26514 4 hat 14 5 sts and 20 row = 4 in hat skeins stitch pattern in the round with larger needles needles blocked hat us 8 5mm 16 circular needles or scarf 16 sts and 18 row = 4 in scarf two sizes smaller than needle to obtain stitch pattern with larger needles gauge blocked for pattern support contact ofelecia@gmail com aberdeen hat and scarf decrease rounds round 1 *ssk p1 k1 repeat from * to end 48 54 60 sts remain notes round 2 *k2 p1 repeat from * to end when first knit i e before blocking the stitches will draw in and round 3 *ssk k1 repeat from * to end 32 36 40 sts remain look somewhat like a standard rib however once blocked the round 4 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end stitches will relax and reveal the ridged faux rib pattern this faux change to larger dpns rib lacks the extreme stretch of a true rib so the bottom edge of round 5 *ssk repeat from * to end 16 18 20 sts remain the hat is worked with smaller needles to tighten the fit finished round 6 k all sts hat has approximately 2 of negative ease the scarf will appear round 7 *ssk repeat from * to end 8 9 10 sts remain much more narrow before blocking than after round 8 k all sts hat stitch pattern worked in the round over multiples of 4 sts cut yarn leaving a tail of at least 8 thread tail through yarn plus 2 needle pull yarn tail through remaining sts and pull to tighten round 1 *k2 p2 repeat from * to end scarf round 2 p1 *k2 p2 repeat from * to last st p1 with larger needles co 41 sts repeat rnds 1-2 for pattern work in scarf stitch pattern until piece reaches an overall length scarf stitch pattern worked flat over multiples of 4 sts plus 1 of 58 every row *k2 p2 repeat from * to last st k1 bobble all sts being careful not to work sts too tightly in order to directions maintain the ridges created by the stitch pattern hat finishing with smaller circular needles loosely co 58 74 82 sts work weave in yarn tails machine wash and tumble dry at a low first round of hat stitch pattern and place marker join sts being temperature careful not to twist and continue working
